articles.description: Two more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Powys today, taking the total number in the county since the outbreak began to 154.
articles.content:
Two more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Powys today, taking the total number in the county since the outbreak began to 154.
The number of people confirmed to have died in the county after contracting the disease remains at seven, Public Health W… [+928 chars]

articles.author: By Milly Vincent For Mailonline
articles.title: Home-testing coronavirus kits are again unavailable for key workers after just 20 minutes - Daily Mail
articles.description: Millions of key workers have failed to secure a home testing kit again today after the UK government website stated 'none available' just twenty minutes after the tests were released.
articles.content:
Millions of key workers have failed to secure a home testing kit again today after the UK government website stated 'none available' just twenty minutes after the tests were released.  
The test site was launched on Friday in an effort to test key workers wh… [+8140 chars]

articles.author: Alahna Kindred
articles.title: Coronavirus patients suffering ‘nasty red rash’ before Covid-19 symptoms - The Sun
articles.content:
A RED rash could be another symptom of coronavirus, experts have warned.
Data from Italy suggests as many as one in five people who are hospitalised with the killer bug may develop rashes or unexplained marks on their skin.
 Scientists are still trying to u… [+3944 chars]

articles.author: Ryan Smith
articles.title: South Tyneside's coronavirus cases stand at 464 as 16 more patients die under care of borough's hospital trust - Shields Gazette
articles.description: Four more coronavirus patients have died at South Tyneside’s NHS hospital trust as the number of cases in the borough rose to 495.
articles.content:
The figures show a total of 252 people have now died in hospitals covered by South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust as of today, Monday, April 27.
In total, 938 people who had tested positive for coronavirus have died across the North Easts hospi… [+3352 chars]
